title: UK-China partnership to develop durable late blight disease resistance in potato
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText:
Our finding are being used to extend collaboration with Huazhong Agricultural University with a view to further funding bids.

Our findings are being used to extend collaboration to other Chinese partners to develop a Chinese research network linked to University of Dundee (especially CIP, Beijing, Fuzhou Agricultural and Foresty University, and CAAS Harbin) Agriculture, Food and Drink,Creative Economy,Education,Environment Cultural,Economic
findingsText: We have demonstrated that a key ubiquitin E3 ligase enzyme functions in the plant nucleus to promote immunity to potato late blight disease We may be able to use this information to improve disease resistance Agriculture, Food and Drink,Education
